title: Tiny Territory: The Founding of Em-Land

textboxes.description: While wandering through the wilderness with Bubba, you come across a peculiar, isolated plot of land—100 meters by 100 meters, perfectly square and utterly uninhabited. A strange border fence and mismatched signage suggest it’s been claimed, unclaimed, and reclaimed for generations. The USSR’s insignia is carved into a stone on one side, while an Ottoman banner flaps in the breeze on the other. Bubba squints, muttering, 'Seems like a no man’s land… ripe for the taking?'

choices.text: Declare it your own sovereign nation: Em-Land.
Investigate the USSR and Ottoman claims first.
Walk away—this is more trouble than it’s worth.

textboxes.description: You boldly proclaim this land as the sovereign territory of Em-Land, with Bubba as your first (and only) citizen. Bubba lets out a triumphant cheer, but your victory is short-lived as two guards—one in Soviet fatigues, the other in Ottoman armor—appear from the bushes, both demanding your immediate withdrawal.

choices.text: Attempt to diplomatically reason with both guards.

skill_check.fail: The guards remain unswayed and prepare to forcibly evict you from the land.

choices.text: Declare your intent to defend Em-Land at all costs.
Offer a bribe to the Soviet guard to ignore your presence.

skill_check.fail: The Soviet guard sees through your bribe attempt and becomes even more hostile.

textboxes.description: You decide to investigate further, starting with the USSR. After a short trek to a nearby outpost, a Soviet officer informs you that this land, though tiny, is 'strategically essential' to their mission, without clarifying why. On the Ottoman side, an envoy explains that this land is considered a sacred, ancient claim of the Empire. Both factions insist they have the rights.

choices.text: Return to the land and declare independence despite the claims.
Suggest a treaty to share the territory among all parties.

skill_check.fail: Neither side is interested in sharing and both guards prepare to take action against you.

choices.text: Abandon the quest and leave the disputed land.

textboxes.description: You try to reason with the guards, proposing that Em-Land could become a peaceful, neutral zone where both factions might coexist. They seem intrigued, but wary.

choices.text: Press forward with a proposal for a neutral shared land.
Declare full independence and set up defenses.
Offer a tribute of rare items from the camper to sweeten the deal.

textboxes.description: You and Bubba scramble to fortify the land, using makeshift defenses and setting up a perimeter. The guards watch with amusement until one begins to draw a weapon.

choices.text: Attempt to outwit the guards with an illusion spell.

skill_check.fail: Your spell falters, and the guards quickly advance, seeing through the illusion.

choices.text: Appeal one last time to the guards’ sense of fairness.
Defend Em-Land by force, using improvised tools.

textboxes.description: You offer the Soviet guard a handful of rare trinkets you’ve picked up along your travels. He examines them with suspicion but pockets one, a slight smile forming.

choices.text: Take advantage of his good mood to reinforce Em-Land’s independence.
Negotiate a neutrality pact with both sides.

textboxes.description: You propose that the land remain a neutral zone where neither faction has full control. After some negotiation, both guards begrudgingly accept, each agreeing to report this solution to their superiors as a tentative truce.

choices.text: Finalize the agreement and establish Em-Land as a neutral territory.
Leave the land as neutral but press for a formal declaration of Em-Land.

textboxes.description: You weave a quick illusion spell, conjuring a massive image of yourself towering over the land. The guards, startled, retreat, convinced they’re witnessing an act of divine intervention.

choices.text: Secure the land quickly and mark it as Em-Land.
Use the opportunity to get concessions from both factions.

textboxes.description: With the Soviet guard’s support, you declare Em-Land as a sovereign micro-nation. The Ottoman guard eyes you suspiciously but decides to report back to his superiors instead of escalating. You now stand as the official ruler of Em-Land—at least for the moment.

choices.text: Hold a small celebration with Bubba, marking the founding of Em-Land.
Begin formalizing Em-Land’s independence.

textboxes.description: You set about formalizing Em-Land’s independence, setting up a flag and drafting a constitution with Bubba. The land’s legitimacy as a micro-nation is still in question, but for now, Em-Land stands tall.

choices.text: Finalize everything and begin living as a sovereign state.
Decide to leave the land behind, having made your mark.

textboxes.description: You’ve successfully declared Em-Land an independent micro-nation, earning tentative recognition from both the USSR and the Ottoman Empire. Bubba grins as he plants a small flag with your insignia. 'Long live Em-Land!' he declares. The two of you share a small feast under the stars, your own tiny kingdom now a reality.

After a lengthy back-and-forth, you decide to leave the land unclaimed. As you and Bubba walk away, you can’t help but feel a pang of regret, but the thought of the land enduring as no man’s land is oddly satisfying.

Despite your efforts, the combined forces of both factions prove overwhelming. You’re forced to retreat, leaving your dreams of Em-Land behind as you and Bubba make a hasty exit. Perhaps your own sovereign nation was too much to ask for… this time.
